object type / vase shape: attic black figure olpe with flat mouth and little lip

- description: hoplite, draped old man with spear, bearded warrior putting on greave, woman holding spear and shield, hoplite - production place: Athens - form class: flat-mouthed oinochoai (other than olpai), A: with no lip or little: various - period / date: ripe / late archaic, ca. 550-500 BC - material: pottery (clay) - findspot: Athens, Agora - museum / inventory number: Athens, Ancient Agora Museum P 5463 - bibliography: John D.
